message.content: This question requires an understanding of what a solution is. A solution is a homogeneous mixture of two or more substances. Option (C) is the correct answer because juice and vodka can be mixed together to create a solution. Option (A) is incorrect because pebbles and soil are not mixable substances and would not form a solution. Option (B) is incorrect because peas and corn are not mixable substances and would not form a solution. Option (D) is incorrect because toothpaste and bristles are not mixable substances and would not form a solution.

This question requires knowledge about what a solution is. A solution is a mixture where two or more substances are evenly distributed, with one being a solvent and the others being solutes. Option (C), juice and vodka, best fits this definition as both are liquids that can mix together to form a solution. Options (A) and (D) are not examples of solutions, but rather combinations of materials. Option (B) is also not a proper example of a solution as peas and corn do not dissolve or mix together in the same way that liquids do.

This question requires understanding the definition of a solution. A solution is a mixture in which one or more substances (solutes) are dissolved into another substance (solvent) to form a homogeneous mixture. Option (C), juice and vodka, represents a mixture where vodka (solvent) can dissolve into the juice (solvent) to form a solution. Option (A) is incorrect because pebbles and soil do not form a solution, they form a mixture. Option (B) is incorrect because peas and corn do not dissolve into each other. Option (D) is incorrect because toothpaste and bristles do not dissolve into each other either.

This question requires a basic understanding of what a solution is. a solution is a homogeneous mixture composed of two or more substances. Option (C) is the correct answer because juice and vodka can be mixed together to form a solution. Option (A) is incorrect because pebbles and soil are not substances that can be mixed together to form a solution. Option (B) is incorrect because peas and corn are also not substances that can form a solution when mixed. Option (D) is incorrect because toothpaste and bristles do not form a solution when combined, they create a toothbrush.

This question requires understanding of what a solution is. A solution is a homogeneous mixture composed of a solvent and a solute. Option (C), juice and vodka, best fits this definition as juice would be the solvent and vodka would be the solute. Option (A), pebbles and soil, is a mixture but not a solution since they do not dissolve into each other. Option (B), peas and corn, is also a mixture but not a solution. Option (D), toothpaste and bristles, is not a mixture at all.

This question requires understanding of what a "solution" is in the context of chemistry or mixing substances. A solution is a homogeneous mixture of two or more substances. Option (C) is the correct answer because juice and vodka can be mixed together to create a homogeneous liquid solution. Options (A), (B), and (D) do not meet the criteria of a solution because they involve solid substances that cannot be easily mixed into a homogeneous mixture. Option (A) refers to a combination of pebbles and soil, which would not create a solution. Option (B) refers to a combination of peas and corn, which would create a mixture of separate entities rather than a homogeneous solution. Option (D) refers to toothpaste and bristles, which are not substances that can be mixed together to create a solution.
